lines.text: CONFIDENTIAL
MEMORANDUM
The Amerizan Tobaeco Company
Mr. R. K. Heimann
To
President and
July 2, 1969
DATE
Chief Operating officer
From
Norman H. Chester
Media Director
SUBJECT
Network TV
This mcmorandum will address several areas of network tele-
vision.
1. Under our three push brand concept, do we have
sufficient weight next fall to meet the
competition?
2. Can we accoumodate a fourth push brand within our
current network conmitments?
3. Recognizing the l969 profit goal, would it be
wise to spend additional funds in network tele-
vision? If so, would we be better advised to
spand $2,000,000 this fall in football, as
tentatively plainad, or spread the investment
over a 52-week parioi?
Let's first review our principle competitor, R. J. Reynolds.
Sasad on current network usage, and our knowledge to date
o their fall network buy, it is anticipated that the
Winston label will have i4 exposures weekly, the Salem
label l0 exposures weekly and the Camel label 4 exposures
weekly.
Next fall, when one oi our brands is in a blitz period, it
will receive 15 network exposures weekly during the third
and fourth weeks of the blitz, plus the I.D. Pool for the
full four weeks of the blitz.' During each brand's non-
blitz period, it will have an average of 8 to 9 network
exposures weekly, but no spot television. Thus each of
our three push brands is at a level competitive with
Winston only during its blitz period.
The introduction of a fourth brand as an equal blitz brand
partner with the present network comaitments would obviously
further increase the spread between the weight of our brands
versus Winston. As an example, if we maintain blitz weight
at ls network exposures during each brand's non-blitz
periods, they would average 6 network exposures. There
vould be periods, however, when a brand would have as
little as 4 or 3 network exposures weekly, compared to
our current minimum of 6 to 7 exposures.
